Package gov.nasa.larcfm.Util

Class Interval

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.larcfm.Util.Interval
  • public class Interval
extends java.lang.Object
    Interval represents a interval of double's from a lower bound to an upper bound. This class is immutable. Whether the interval is interpreted as open or closed is context-dependent. There are various membership tests allowing for the different interpretations.

    • Field Summary

      • intersect

        public Interval intersect​(Interval r)
        Returns a new interval which is the intersection of the current Interval and the given Interval. If the two regions do not overlap, then an empty region is returned.
        Parameters:
        r - interval
        Returns:
        intersection or empty

      • overlap

        public boolean overlap​(Interval r)
        Does the given Interval overlap with this Interval. Intervals that only share an endpoint do not overlap, for example, (1.0,2.0) and (2.0,3.0) do not overlap.
        Parameters:
        r - interval
        Returns:
        true if overlap

      • includes

        public boolean includes​(Interval r)
        Return true if r is a subset of this interval
        Parameters:
        r - interval
        Returns:
        true if inside

      • shift

        public Interval shift​(double d)
        Shift this interval by a given amount
        Parameters:
        d - amount to shift (add to both bounds)
        Returns:
        new interval
